body.value: Keep secret until: As a main player, after cards are revealed, you may reveal this moon to cause each of your ships to be worth triple for totals, compensation, and rewards for this encounter.
Keep secret until: At any time, you may reveal this moon to force all players who have your flare to give it to you. If nobody can, you may search the discard pile for it and take it
Keep secret until: As an ally you may reveal this moon to triple the value of each reinforcement played by allies on your side for this encounter.
Keep secret until: At any time, you may reveal this moon to remove any moon from the game and send any ships on it to the warp
Keep secret until: At any time, you may reveal this moon to force a player with the most foreign colonies to send all their ships from a foreign colony to their other colonies.
Keep secret until: As the defense, before allies are invited, you may reveal this moon. Players cannot become allies with the offense during this encounter.
Keep secret until: After a player plays a card with "Zap" in its name, you may reveal this moon to cancel the effect of that card.
Keep secret until: As a main player, after cards are revealed, you may reveal this moon to add 3 to your total for each moon occupied by other players.
At the start of your turn, shuffle the discard pile and deal all of those cards to the players, starting with yourself and proceeding clockwise.
Each player must hum whenever they are not talking or breathing in. Each time a player is caught not humming, they send one of their ships not in the encounter to the warp.
At the start of your turn, each player discards their alien sheet(s) and draws replacements. Redraw each alien that has Game Setup text or is not allowed.
During the regroup phase, each player must discard one card of their choice from their hand.
At the start of your turn, deal the cards remaining in the deck to the players, starting with yourself and proceeding clockwise.
When revealed, the game ends. The player with the most colonies (including foreign and home) wins! If playing a campaign, use the number of colonies to determine ranking.
Each player must speak in rhymes. When a player is caught speaking without a rhyme - not including reading game text aloud - they send one of their to the warp.
At the start of your turn, sing a short song about your alien power. Then, gain a reward.
For each occupied moon, the offense must add 1 to their total.
For each occupied moon, the defense must add 1 to their total.
When a player draws a new hand, they draw three fewer cards.
Any revealed attack 40 is treated as an attack 04, and vice versa.
The offense's ship limit is increased by one.
The offense's ship limit is decreased by one.
Each foreign colony on this moon's planet is worth two foreign colonies.
The number of encounters a player can have per turn is reduced by one (to minimum a of one).
The number of encounters a player can have per turn is increased by one.
Each main player must select a negotiate, if able.

After alliances are formed, each player that was not invited to ally may offer a card from their hand to one main player. If the main player takes it, that uninvited player becomes one of their allies.
During the regroup phase, each player other than the offense draws one card.
When you fail to make a deal, lose one fewer ship. If you occupy at least two half moons, lose two fewer instead.
Add 2 to each reinforcement you play. If you occupy at least two half moons, add 4 instead.
When you draw a new hand, draw one additional card. If you occupy at least two half moons, draw two additional instead.
When you gain rewards, gain one additional reward. If you occupy at least two half moons, gain two additional instead.
During your regroup phase, retrieve one additional ship. If you occupy at least two half moons, retrieve two additional instead.
As the offense, increase your ship limit by one. If you occupy at least two half moons, increase it by two instead.
You can play one additional flare per encounter. If you occupy at least two half moons, you can play two additional instead. (Each flare can only be played once per encounter)
When you collect compensation, collect one additional card. If you occupy at least two half moons, collect two additional instead.
As part of a deal, you and your opponent can each draw up to two cards from the deck
After you make a successful deal, gain one reward.
As part of a deal, you and your opponent can each discard up to two cards from hand.
After you make a successful deal, you may take a card at random from the hand of each player with a colony on this moon's planet.
If you fail to make a deal, you may send one of your opponent's ships to the warp from each planet where you both have a colony.
As part of a deal, you and your opponent can each discard your hands and draw new hands.
As part of a deal, you and your opponent can each draw a flare from the unused flare deck.
As part of a deal, you can send up to two of your opponent's ships from the warp to this moon's planet.
This moon is treated as a colony. At the start of each player's turn, send one of your ships from one of your colonies to the warp.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. Your ships cannot be removed from the warp.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. You cannot win the game unless you have a colony on each planet in your home system.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. During the regroup phase, if you have more than four cards in your hand, you must discard down to four cards of your choice.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. During the regroup phase, if you have nine or fewer ships ships in the warp, send your ships to the warp until there are ten of your ships there.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. After you use your power, send one of your ships to the warp.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. You cannot have more than one encounter on your turn.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. When you become an ally, you cannot send more than one ship.
Keep secret until: at any time you may reveal this moon to choose another occupied moon. Send that moon's ship to the warp and move the ship on this moon to that moon.
To win the game normally, player must also occupy at a least one moon.
This moon is treated as a colony. You cannot select your highest-value encounter card unless you have no other attack cards.
When players make a deal, you ship may send your ship here to your colonies and flip this moon facedown to prevent the terms of the deal from resolving. (The deal is still successful.)
Keep secret until: After you fail to make a deal, you may reveal this moon. If you do, do not lose any ships to the warp and your opponent loses three additional ships.
This moon is treated as a foreign colony. Each time you play an artifact, reinforcement, or flare, remove one of your ships from the game.
When revealed, each player give you all flares from their hand. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, each other player gives you one card of their choice from their hand. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, each other player shows you all artifacts and flares in their hand. If this moon unoccupied, flip it facedown.
Keep secret until: As a main player, after cards are revealed, you may reveal this moon to double the value of an attack card you revealed.
This moon is treated as a home colony and a half moon. If you occupy at least two half moons, this moon is treated as two home colonies and two half moons instead.
When revealed, each other player gives you all negotiate cards from their hand. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
If a player does not occupy any planets, they win the game!
Reveal at any time: during your regroup phase, instead of retrieving a ship from the warp, you may draw a card from the unused flare deck
Keep secret until: After a non-encounter card is discarded, you may reveal this moon to add that card to your hand.
Keep secret until: As a main player, after alliances are formed, you may reveal this moon to force all of your allies to send ships until they have as many in the encounter as you do.
Keep secret until: When you would a number of gain rewards, you may reveal this moon to send that number of ships belonging to other players to the warp instead
When revealed, draw a sky city card (13) and place its marker on this moon's planet. Move the ship from this moon to the planet and remove this moon from the game.
When a destiny card is discarded, it is removed from the game instead. While there are no destiny cards in the game, each destiny is wild.
Keep secret until: At any time, you may reveal this moon to discard your hand and draw a new one.
When revealed, search the deck for negotiate cards and give one to each player. Then, shuffle the deck. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, name a card with "Zap" in its name. Each player that has it must give it to you. If none do, take it from the deck. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, draw another alien sheet to use in addition to your alien(s). Redraw any that have Game Setup text or are not allowed. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, draw four cards from the deck. Then, discard four cards from your hand. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, discard one of your alien sheets and draw another one. Redraw any that have Game Setup text or are not allowed. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, each player must show you the highest and lowest value attack cards in their hand. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, move one of each player's ships to another of their colonies. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
When revealed, each player gives you one card from their hand at random. You keep one of them and discard the rest. If this moon is unoccupied, flip it facedown.
Reveal at any time: As an ally, add the number of occupied moons to your sides total.
You cannot reveal this moon. This moon has no ability (but you should look pleased at having just read this).
Reveal at any time: While you are an ally, allies' ships are worth double for totals, compensation, and rewards.
Reveal at any time: While you are an ally, allies' ships are worth half (rounding down) for totals, compensation, and rewards.
Reveal at any time: You do not lose your alien power from having too few home colonies.
Reveal at any time: When you gain rewards as a defensive ally, double the amount you gain.
Reveal at any time: At the start of each turn, you may place a card from your hand facedown on top of the deck
Reveal at any time: After determining the outcome, if you are an ally on the losing side, you may collect compensation from either main player.
